conclusion: Analyze forces acting on latch D in self-locking state
Self-locking occurs when frictional force prevents latch movement
Identify forces: spring force Fs, normal force FN, frictional force Ff
Spring force Fs calculated using Hooke's Law: Fs = kx
In self-locking state, net force along motion direction is zero
Component of spring force along sliding direction is Fs sin θ
Frictional force Ff = μ FN acts opposite to sliding motion
Equilibrium condition: μ FN = Fs sin θ
Substitute Fs = kx into equilibrium condition: μ FN = kx sin θ
Solve for normal force FN: FN = (kx sin θ) / μ
Substitute sin θ = 1/2 into equation: FN = (kx / 2μ)
